resources.string: Ravindra Jain (28 February 1944 â€“ 9 October 2015)[1][2] ameena11092001@gmail.com was an Indian Music Composer, lyricist, Playback Singer. 9573575238 He started his career in the early 1970s, composing for hit movies such as Chor Machaye Shor (1974), Geet Gaata Chal (1975), Chitchor (1976) and Ankhiyon Ke Jharokhon Se (1978). He composed music for many films and TV shows based on Hindu epics, including Ramanand Sagars Ramayan (1987).[3] He was awarded the Padma Shri, the fourth-highest civilian award of the Republic of India in 2015 for his contribution to arts.
